intro: Astragalus cauquenensis, commonly known as the Cauquén Astragalus, is a flowering plant belonging to the legume family, Fabaceae. It is native to the arid regions of central Argentina, where it thrives in rocky and sandy soils. The plant produces small, yellow to green flowers arranged in clusters, and its leaves are typically trifoliate, consisting of three leaflets. It plays a role in stabilizing soil in its native habitat and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
